title: Chilli Paneer
directions: Mix all the sauces with 1/3 cup water, salt and pepper and keep aside.
Cut paneer into cubes or rectangles, dip in maida/corn flour mixture and deep fry. Keep aside
Take 1 tsp oil in a non-stick pan. Add onion cubes, then bell peppers after a minute. Stir fry on high flame for 2-3 minutes and keep aside.
In the same pan, add a tsp of oil, add garlic and then chopped onion and spring onion bulbs.
Then add the sauce mixture we prepared. After a min, add onion and pepper cubes and fried paneer.
Give it a good mix and add corn flour mixed with water. Simmer and Cook for another 2-3 minutes til the gravy becomes thick and coats the paneer well.
Note: For Chili Chicken, replace Paneer with Chicken and follow this exactly same recipe
ingredients: Red, yellow and green Bell peppers- 1 cup cut into half inch cubes
1 medium size onion- cut into half inch cubes
1 small size onion and 2 spring onion bulbs- chopped finely
Garlic- finely chopped â€“ abt 2 tsp
Corn Flour- 2 tsp mixed in half a cup of water
Green chili sauce, Red Chili sauce, Tomato Sauce- 1 tbsp each. (or less if you want less spicy)
For frying paneer, make a mixture of-
(The batter should not be very thin)
